resources.string: A charge of energy with short and fast workouts

The Body Mass Index (BMI) or Body Mass Index (BMI) is a widely used parameter for obtaining a general assessment of your body weight. It relates height and weight of the subject to a simple mathematical formula. It is obtained by dividing the weight in kg of the subject with the square of the height expressed in meters. The result of this formula classifies the subject in an area of weight that can be: normal - underweight - overweight - medium grade obesity - high grade obesity. 
 
 16-18,49 UNDERWEIGHT 
 18.5-24.99 NORMAL WEIGHT 
 25-29,99 OVERWEIGHT 
 30-34,99 OBESITY 
 
 Example: 
 If your weight is 80 kg and you are 185 cm tall, your BMI is: 
 80 / (1.85 x 1.85) = 23.4 
 Your body weight is in the NORMOPESO range
To reach your goal, you will need to consume

Total daily energy consumption or TDEE (acronym for Total Daily Energy Expenditure: literally total daily energy expenditure) is nothing more than an estimate of how many calories we burn daily. This is a different value from the basal metabolic rate (BMR) in that it takes into account not only the same basal metabolic rate but also the levels of activity we do. 
 Here is a step-by-step guide to calculate your BMR using the Harris-Benedict equation: 
 Women BMR = 655 + (9.6 X weight in kg) + (1.8 x height in cm) - (4.7 x age in years) 
 
 BMR man = 66 + (13.7 X weight in kg) + (5 x height in cm) - (6.8 x age in years) \ nFor example, lets take a 30 year old male named Luca who is 180 cm tall and weighs 78 kilos. 
 
 BMR = 66 + (13.7 x 78) + (5 x 180) - (6.8 x 30) 
 BMR = 66 + 1068.6 + 900 - 204 
 BMR = 1830.6 
 
 So, as a minimum necessary to sustain life and ensure longevity, our Luca would need to consume about 1830 calories. 
 
 The next step in understanding TDEE would be to calculate the thermal effect of food, as well as non-exercise and exercise factors.Fortunately, you dont have to spend hours doing more tedious calculations. Researchers have determined a series of "activity multipliers", known as Katch-McArdle multipliers. 
 
 To calculate your approximate TDEE, just multiply these activity factors from your BMR: 
 
 Sedentary (little or no exercise + desk work) = 1.2 
 Slightly active (light exercise 1-3 days / week) = 1.375 
 Moderately active (moderate exercise 3-5 days / week) = 1.55 \ nVery active (heavy training 6-7 days / week) = 1,725 ​​
 
 Extremely active (very heavy exercise, hard work, 2x training / day) = 1,9 
 
 By going back to our example, lets assume that Luca trains 2 days a week. This puts Luca in the "Slightly Active" category. 
 
 For Lucas approximate TDEE calculation, multiply his BMR by 1,375. This gives us: 
 
 TDEE = 1,375 x BMR 
 TDEE = 1,375 x 1830 
 TDEE = 2517 
 
 So, from calculating the TDEE, our example Luca needs to consume about 2500 calories per day just to maintain his current weight.

Average Daily Intake of Kilocalories recommended is about 1800 to 2600 kcals
Average person should take at least 10,000 steps per day to maintain good health, which is equal to about 5 miles of walking

Walking at least 30 minutes a day is a real health cure. Especially if you are not very trained, it is better to prefer walking to running. Walking does not require excessive physical effort and allows you to move constantly every day without tiring too much and without getting bored.Each day you can change your path, decide to go for a walk in the company of different people or to take advantage of the walk to discover roads that you had never crossed. Walking will provide your body with many benefits. It will help you keep fit, lose weight and feel younger. Here are the main benefits of a healthy walk in the fresh air. 

Reduces breast cancer risk 
Reduces heart disease risk 
Longens life 
Like weight faster 
Preventing Diabetes 
Stimulates Creativity 
Increases productivity 
Prevents childhood obesity 
Increases immune defenses 
Awakens the immune system Thyroid
